message.content:
To identify the specific line item and value of costs incurred to secure customer orders and to deliver goods and services to customers, we generally look for 'Cost of Goods Sold' (COGS) since it represents the direct costs attributable to the production of the goods sold by a company, which includes the costs incurred to deliver the goods and services.

Based on the income statement provided:

```
### income statement
| Account | Amount | Date |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Main Business Revenue | 5755241.17 | 2024-01-29 |
| Total Revenue | 5755241.17 | 2024-01-29 |
| Cost of Goods Sold | 4680000.00 | 2024-01-29 |
| Total Cost | 4680000.00 | 2024-01-29 |
| Gross Profit | 1075241.17 | 2024-01-29 |
| Administrative Expenses | 1082287.97 | 2024-01-29 |
| Selling Expenses | 463643.51 | 2024-01-29 |
| Depreciation | 45745.79 | 2024-01-29 |
| Financial Expenses | 549407.19 | 2024-01-29 |
| Total Expenses | 2141084.46 | 2024-01-29 |
| Interest Income | 1225.71 | 2024-01-29 |
| Profit Before Tax | -1064617.58 | 2024-01-29 |
| Tax Expense | 287762.05 | 2024-01-29 |
| Net Profit | -1352379.63 | 2024-01-29 |
```

From this income statement, we can see that the line item for 'Cost of Goods Sold' (COGS) has the specified amount of:

- **Cost of Goods Sold**: 4680000.00

This value represents the costs incurred to secure customer orders and to deliver the goods and services to customers.

Putting this into the desired JSON format:

```json
{"solution": {'value': '4680000.00'}}
```
